description:
Contains relevant property values of a fluid medium.
Schema on github: https://github.com/Engineer2B/PowerCalculator-Schemas
title: Representation of a fluid medium.

___Acoustic attenuation.description:
The attenuation of an acoustic wave in the medium.
Can also be an equation string with parameter 'T' for temperature in [K].
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attenuation 
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neper
Unit: [Np/m].

___Heat absorption fraction.description:
The fraction of the heat that contributes to a temperature increase.
Unit: [-].

___Density.description:
The amount of mass per volume.
Can also be an equation string with parameter 'T' for temperature in [K].
 ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Density 
Unit: [kg/(m^3)].

___Name.description: A unique identifier of the fluid medium.

___Atmospheric pressure freezing point.description:
The temperature at 1 atm at which the medium changes to the solid phase.
Unit: [K]

___Speed of sound.description:
The speed of sound in the medium.
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speed_of_sound 
Unit: [m/s].

___Thermal conductivity.description:
The property of a material to conduct heat evaluated in terms of Fourier's Law for heat conduction.
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermal_conductivity 
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laser_flash_analysis 
Unit: [(kg m)/(s^3 K)] or, more familiar, [(W m)/K].

___Isobaric mass heat capacity.description:
The ratio of the heat added to (or removed from) an object to the resulting temperature change per unit mass at a constant pressure.
ðŸ”—https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Table_of_specific_heat_capacities&oldid=896766640 
Unit: [(m^2)/(K s^2)] or, more familiar, [J/(kg K)].
